title: David Hasselhoff rocks Zurich as he continues tour in support of 14th studio album Open Your Eyes
text:
He's an icon in Germany thanks to his song Looking for Freedom that was number one for two months in 1989 in the run up to the tearing down of the Berlin Wall.

And David Hasselhoff, 67, is currently performing a series of concerts in Germany, Austria and Switzerland on his Freedom! The Journey Continues Tour.

While he's best known in his native US for his TV shows Knight Rider and Baywatch, in central Europe it's his music that makes him a star.

Music man: David Hasselhoff performed on stage in Zurich, Switzerland, on Monday night as part of his Freedom! The Journey Continues Tour

He's had number one albums not just in Germany but also in Austria and Switzerland.

On Monday night, the 67-year-old was on stage in Zurich.

He's just released his 14th studio album Open Your Eyes, a collection of covers including Sweet Caroline, If You Could Read My Mind, I Melt With You and Rhinestone Cowboy.

14th studio album: The 67-year-old, who's had number one albums in Germany, Austria and Switzerland over the past 30 years, is promoting his new album of cover songs Open Your Eyes

Icon in Germany: While he's best known in his native US for his TV shows Knight Rider and Baywatch, in central Europe it's his music that makes him a star

Meanwhile, Hasselhoff's daughter Hayley Hasselhoff, one of two daughters he shares with ex-wife Pamela Bach, is also keen to make it as a singer.

Hayley, 27, a plus-size model, is currently appearing on the British TV reality show The X Factor: Celebrity.

During an interview on ITV's This Morning, she revealed her famous father 'always wanted me to pursue a solo career on my own.'

Hasselhoff and Bach, the actor's second wife, divorced in 2006 after 17 years of marriage.

In 2018, he married for the third time, tying the knot with Hayley Roberts, a Welsh former shop assistant 27 years his junior.
